shared_text:
Ava R-1 Schools
September 2 at 9:31 AM ·

WELLNESS WEDNESDAY!

Do you want a fun way for your kids to be active? Then check this out! Marathon Kids is a run/walk program that encourages kids to be active. It's for kids in grades K-12 in our area. (They do not have to be enrolled in Ava Schools.) Kids can do the program at home, the park, recess, PE, or basically anywhere that they can be active.

Marathon Kids will kick off their first run club meet Saturday, September 12 at the high school football field from 8:00 am to 10:00 am. Runners can stop by anytime and run or walk laps. Run club meets are not mandatory. More detail will come out next week for those signed up! The deadline for sign up is September 11. If you have questions then please email bharvill@avabears.net
https://app.marathonkids.org/club-profile/611/enroll/true

You don't want to miss out on the fun.

#AvaBearNation #BeingActive #StayingHealty

We are looking forward to getting the new school year started. We are excited to welcome all the students this morning.

Our goal is to educate students in the safest environment and as normal as possible during this challenging time. Please be patient with us as we make adjustments as the situation requires.

New Student Registration will be Tuesday, August 11 and Wednesday, August 12 from 8:30 - 3:00. The following documents are needed to enroll your student; birth certificate, immunization records and proof of residency.

post_text: Plainview R-8 School is seeking qualified applicants to teach a combined 7th & 8th grade classroom. Interested applicants must have a Valid Missouri Teaching Certificate. You will be responsible for planning lessons, carrying out effective instruction, and evaluating student progress. Accountable for creating a positive and productive classroom learning environment. Applicants need to have good communication skills, a desire to collaborate with others, and the ability to make data-informed decisions that enhance instruction. Email application, resume, and three letters of recommendation to brendareed@plainviewschool.org. Application available on the school website plainviewschool.org.

Applicants need to have good communication skills, a desire to collaborate with others, and the ability to make data-informed decisions that enhance instruction. post_text:
End of the year update - Food pick up next week will be on Tuesday, May 12, 9 to 11. We will also be collecting work that the students have completed at that time.

Friday, May 15, we will be handing out grade cards, certificates, etc at the school 9 to 12. Most of the teachers will be here at this time so they can wave or say hi to the students. This will be a drive through situation, no one will be getting out of the cars.

We will be doing Virtual Summer School May 18 - June 5. We are also looking at a seated/virtual combination in June and or seated in July. More information will be sent to parents about this.

Plainview School
April 21 at 11:21 AM ·

The Plainview R-VIII School District is accepting applications for a preschool aide to begin in August 2020. Applicant must have 60 college hours, and meet Missouri Department of Health & Senior Services licensing requirements. Applications may be received by email or on the school web page. Email completed applications to brendareed@plainviewschool.org or Mail to Brenda Reed, Plainview School, Route 3 Box 145, Ava, MO 65608. If you have any questions please contact Ms. Brenda Reed, principal by
email brendareed@plainviewschool.org or by phone 417-250-0425. Applications will be accepted until Friday, May 8, at noon.

Food pick-up Monday, April 20. If you have not signed up for food and would like to get it contact 417-250-0425. Meals are provided for anyone 18 and younger in the community.

The next work pick up will be Monday, April 27. You can drop off any work students have completed at that time. Please also return any library books your students have.

Teachers are cleaning out classrooms and lockers. Students personal belongings will be available for pick up on Monday, April 27.

We will have something for our graduates, just not sure what it will be at this time.

We really miss the students and can't wait until we are back in school together!

Missouri Department of Elementary and Secondary Education
March 19 at 5:18 PM ·

‪“There is a time and a place for statewide required assessments and now is not the time. Effective immediately, Missouri will be cancelling statewide required assessments for this school year,” said Missouri Commissioner of Education Margie Vandeven.

This is uncharted waters for all of us and we appreciate every ones understanding and cooperation!

post_text:
March 16, 2020

Novel Coronavirus (COVID-19) Update

The Plainview School district would like to update parents and community members on measures being taken by the district as we monitor the spread and impact of the Novel Coronavirus (COVID-19). We have made the decision to extend Spring Break through Friday, April 3rd. Classes will resume on April 6, at this time. We will be updating with details regarding Meal Service and Instructional Plans in the coming days. We will continue to monitor the situation, and gather input from state and local health officials.
We will continue to share updated information as quickly as possible.
text:
March 16, 2020

Novel Coronavirus (COVID-19) Update

The Plainview School district would like to update parents and community members on measures being taken by the district as we monitor the spread and impact of the Novel Coronavirus (COVID-19). We have made the decision to extend Spring Break through Friday, April 3rd. Classes will resume on April 6, at this time. We will be updating with details regarding Meal Service and Instructional Plans in the coming days. We will continue to monitor the situation, and gather input from state and local health officials.
We will continue to share updated information as quickly as possible.

post_text:
Preschool & Kindergarten Enrollment 2020-2021

Plainview R-8 School will be accepting applications for preschool starting on March 1, 2020. A child will be eligible for preschool if they will be 3 or 4 before August 1, 2020. You may pick up a preschool packet at the school office. Please return completed forms no later than April 1, 2020.

If your child will be attending Kindergarten this fall and is not enrolled in our Preschool, call the school to set up a screening time. Children must be 5 years old before August 1,2020 to be enrolled in kindergarten.
If you have any questions or concerns, please call the school at 417-683-2046 or email brendareed@plainviewschool.org.
text:
Preschool & Kindergarten Enrollment 2020-2021

Plainview R-8 School will be accepting applications for preschool starting on March 1, 2020. A child will be eligible for preschool if they will be 3 or 4 before August 1, 2020. You may pick up a preschool packet at the school office. Please return completed forms no later than April 1, 2020.

If your child will be attending Kindergarten this fall and is not enrolled in our Preschool, call the school to set up a screening time. Children must be 5 years old before August 1,2020 to be enrolled in kindergarten.
If you have any questions or concerns, please call the school at 417-683-2046 or email brendareed@plainviewschool.org.

post_text: Three members will be elected to the Board of Education for a term of three years each at the April 7, 2020 election. Candidates may file during regular business hours, 8:00 a.m. to 3:30 p.m. in the school district’s office. The closing date for filing is January 21, 2020, 5:00 p.m. The office may be closed at times due to inclement weather. If you are interested contact the office for more information.

post_text:
Pre-School and Kindergarten Enrollment
We are currently enrolling for Preschool and kindergarten for the fall of 2019. To enroll in preschool child must be 3 before August 2019 and Kindergarten 5 before August 1, 2019. If you have a child that needs to be put on the list contact Mrs. Reed. Enrollment packets can be picked up in the office. Parents enrolling a student will need to provide proof of residency (utility bill, personal property tax receipt, or rent receipt), shot record, birth certificate, proof of health insurance, and social security card (optional). If you have any questions, please contact Mrs. Reed at 683-2046..
text:
Pre-School and Kindergarten Enrollment
We are currently enrolling for Preschool and kindergarten for the fall of 2019. To enroll in preschool child must be 3 before August 2019 and Kindergarten 5 before August 1, 2019. If you have a child that needs to be put on the list contact Mrs. Reed. Enrollment packets can be picked up in the office. Parents enrolling a student will need to provide proof of residency (utility bill, personal property tax receipt, or rent receipt), shot record, birth certificate, proof of health insurance, and social security card (optional). If you have any questions, please contact Mrs. Reed at 683-2046..

shared_text:
Ava R-1 Schools
March 8, 2018 at 8:49 AM ·

Have a current 8th grader that attends Plainview, Skyline, or Thornfield? We wanted to pass along some information on when Ms.Burkdoll (High School Counselor) and Dr.Nash (High School Principal) would be meeting with your student(s) in regards to registering for Ava High School.

Friday, March 9th at 10:30, Thornfield students will be visiting the AHS campus to take a tour and discuss scheduling options.

Monday, March 19 at 11:30, Ms.Burkdoll and Dr.Nash will be visiting Skyline students at Skyline to discuss scheduling options.

Tuesday, April 10, Ms.Burkdoll and Dr.Nash will be visiting Plainview parents and students at Planview schools at 6:30 pm.

Please be watching the schools Facebook page and the Douglas County Herald for registration dates in the summer. New students not currently enrolled in the Ava R-I School District must fill out enrollment papers prior to the school year starting.

We look forward to seeing and meeting new faces and can't wait to have them in our hallways!

Ava R-1 Schools
July 22, 2017 at 5:47 PM ·

We wanted to let the community know about an important event that is right around the corner. The Crosslines Mobile Food Pantry will be in town on Friday August 11. This event is not based on income guidelines. Our amazing leaders and students of NHS and Student Council will be there to help load bags of food and load them into your vehicle. We will be there until the food runs out! Please help spread the word! #hunger #health #hygiene #caretolearn #crosslines #servantleadership #seeaneed #meetaneed #helpfortoday #hopefortomorrow

post_text:
KINDERGARTEN, PRESCHOOL & PAT (Parents as Teachers)
ENROLLMENT AT PLAINVIEW SCHOOL

Please call the school at (417)683-2046 between 8:30 a.m. and 3:30 p.m. to set up a time for screening appointments by Friday, April 7. Kindergarten children must be five years old before August 1, 2017 and live in the Plainview district. Parents will need to bring their child’s birth certificate, social security card, immunization records and verification of residency. Preschool students must be three years old before August 1, 2017. PAT includes children birth to five, that live in the Plainview district.
text:
KINDERGARTEN, PRESCHOOL & PAT (Parents as Teachers)
ENROLLMENT AT PLAINVIEW SCHOOL

Please call the school at (417)683-2046 between 8:30 a.m. and 3:30 p.m. to set up a time for screening appointments by Friday, April 7. Kindergarten children must be five years old before August 1, 2017 and live in the Plainview district. Parents will need to bring their child’s birth certificate, social security card, immunization records and verification of residency. Preschool students must be three years old before August 1, 2017. PAT includes children birth to five, that live in the Plainview district.

post_text: Tonight is our 1st quarter Family Fun Night. We will be seving chili and hot dogs 6 to 6:30. The egg drop will start at 6:45. Families bring your container. We will provide the eggs. Hope to see everyone tonight.

post_text:
We will be celebrating Red Ribbon Week October 24 - 27. The theme for the week is I love my drug free selfie. Students get a small prize each day they participate. Monday is Follow your dreams...Don't do drugs. -Wear your pajamas and bring a stuffed animal.
Tuesday is Team up against drugs. - Dress like an athlete or wear your favorite team apparel.
Wednesday is My future is bright without drugs. - Dress as the occupation you want to be.
Thursday is Selfie day. Students are to dress nice for the day. They can bring cameras or other devices to take selfies.
